business.headline: Gold, silver prices fall: Should you buy now or wait?If the sudden drop in gold and silver prices has caught your eye, it's worth knowing what's driving the mood right now.

Budget 2026 jitters on Dalal Street: Why stock market is under pressureMost global markets have been under pressure this week, especially technology-heavy indices, and the impact has spilled over into emerging markets like India.

Budget 2026 Live: Will Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget offer relief to people?Budget 2026 Live Updates: A day ahead of the Union Budget, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tabled the Economic Survey 2025–26 in Parliament, outlining the government's assessment of the economy.

Rupee hits lifetime low of Rs 92 against US dollar: Should you be worried?The rupee's weakness comes at a time when global uncertainty remains high and foreign capital flows into emerging markets have slowed

Sensex falls 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayAt around 9:30 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 516.43 points at 82,049.94. The NSE Nifty50 fell 192.75 points to 25,226.15. Market participants appeared to be booking profits and reducing risk as Budget Day approached.

Sensex, Nifty open in red as metal and IT stocks drag indices ahead of BudgetThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 491.22 points to 82,075.15, while the NSE Nifty50 tanked 163.95 points to 25,254.95 as of 9:25 am.

From reforms, jobs to resilience: CEA's key messages before Budget 2026As policymakers finalise the Union Budget 2026, CEA V Anantha Nageswaran has shared key insights on how reforms, employment growth and economic resilience can keep India on a steady path.

Why is the Economic Survey talking about junk food, social media restrictions?An economic survey is mostly about GDP growth and projections. So, why did the Economic Survey 2025-26 talk about rising junk food consumption, obesity and excessive screen time? Citing government data, Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran explained how poor physical and mental health among adolescents and working-age adults could weaken productivity and hurt India's long-term economic prospects.

Many jobs are immune to AI disruptions. Economic Survey lists themEven as Artificial Intelligence reshapes workplaces worldwide, the Economic Survey 2025-26 points to jobs that could be immune to AI disruptions. The survey has identified the kinds of jobs that technology is least likely to replace and explains why soft skills and hands-on expertise matter in an AI-driven economy.

From startups to scale-ups: What women entrepreneurs want from Budget 2026For many women entrepreneurs, the ask from Budget 2026 is clear: help them grow bigger. After years of startup-focused policies, they now want support that enables scale, competitiveness and long-term sustainability.

Sensex, Nifty close higher as Economic Survey lifts market mood ahead of BudgetThe Nifty 50 closed 0.3% higher at 25,418.90, while the BSE Sensex rose 0.27% to end at 82,566.37. Both indices recovered after falling around 0.8% earlier in the day, as buying returned in heavyweight stocks.

From inflation, AI to mental health: 6 key takeaways from CEA's Economic Survey briefingIndia's economic outlook is improving on several fronts, but fresh risks are also coming into focus. Speaking at the Economic Survey briefing, the CEA highlighted six key trends shaping growth, jobs, technology and mental well-being.

RTI reveals NITI Aayog has no research on long-term impact of 'Freebies'According to its annual reports, the think tank has completed 34 studies since 2022 and approved 32 new research studies during the same period, yet none relate to the fiscal sustainability or long-term economic consequences of state freebie schemes.

8th Pay Commission: Can employees expect a bigger pay hike this time?The 8th Pay Commission has raised hopes of a higher salary hike for central government employees and pensioners. With consumption slowing and incomes under pressure, expectations this time are higher than in the past.

Rupee sinks to lifetime low of Rs 92: Why is it falling again?The rupee's record low comes amid heavy foreign outflows, weak global cues, limited RBI intervention and delayed exporter inflows, leaving the currency stuck unless policy action or fresh foreign buying emerges.

Budget 2026: Jewellery industry pushes for GST cuts, duty relief and simpler rulesAs Budget 2026 approaches, India's jewellery industry is calling for lower taxes and simpler rules to boost demand, support jobs and bring more buyers back to the market.
Economic Survey 2026 pegs FY27 growth to be 6.8%–7.2%, higher than last yearIndia's economy expected to grow at 6.8%-7.2%, higher than last year's outlook: Economic Survey 2026

India–EU FTA: Why is the 'Mother of All Deals' India's global moment?At a time when protectionism and economic nationalism are resurging globally, the India–EU FTA demonstrates that large economies can still choose cooperation over confrontation. It reflects confidence in India's macroeconomic stability, regulatory predictability, and reform trajectory.

Indonesia's richest man loses nearly $9 billion in a day. Here's whyThe biggest loss was suffered by Prajogo Pangestu, Indonesia's richest person. His net worth fell by around $9 billion after shares of his energy and mining companies dropped sharply.

Gold crosses Rs 1.8 lakh, silver above Rs 4 lakh: 4 key reasons for the surgeThe unstoppable gold and silver rally has been fuelled by global uncertainty, strong demand and powerful technical momentum that have kept precious metals on an unbroken upward run.

entertainment.headline: Alia Bhatt returns to production, announces new film Don't Be Shy Alia Bhatt and sister Shaheen are set to bankroll Prime Video's original film 'Don't Be Shy'. The film is about a 20-year-old girl whose life takes unexpected twists, and everything goes out of control.

Blackpink's Deadline: Concept teaser for first group comeback in 3 years out now Blackpink kicked off their comeback countdown by unveiling the first concept teaser for their third mini album, Deadline. Released by YG Entertainment, the striking black-and-white visuals have heightened anticipation ahead of the album's February 27 launch.

Gandhi Talks review: Vijay Sethupathi's silent film deserves loud applauseRelease Date:Fri Jan 30, 2026 Gandhi Talks movie review: Gandhi Talks is a silent film starring Vijay Sethupathi and Arvind Swami that explores the impact of money on human values. The film's unique silent narrative challenges viewers to reflect on morality amid chaos.

Cryptic billboards in Varanasi spark buzz over SS Rajamouli's film release date Mysterious billboards in Varanasi displaying a potential release date of SS Rajamouli's Varanasi have generated significant curiosity among fans and observers. However, no official confirmation has been issued by the makers.

Exclusive: Send Help producer on Rachel McAdams, Dylan O'Brien, workplace rage As Send Help hits theatres, film producer Zainab Azizi spoke to us about the long journey of the film, why Linda's transformation needed careful handling and more.

Lost my second child: Rani Mukerji on what shaped Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway role Rani Mukerji revealed the emotional significance of receiving the script for 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway' after her miscarriage, and how her experience influenced her decision to portray the story.

Dhurandhar on OTT: Fans upset as Netflix censors, mutes scenes of Ranveer's film After creating waves globally, Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' is streaming on OTT. However, fans are quite disappointed with Netflix as the platform muted and censored certain scenes of the 'A' rated film.

AR Rahman among global guests at Melania Trump documentary premiere in the US Oscar-winning composer AR Rahman will join international and political figures at the Kennedy Center for the premiere of Melania, a documentary on Melania Trump.

Border 2 beyond emotional weight: When familiar tropes fight the war Border 2 delivers the emotional certainty that audiences expect from a war film. But when the dust settles, it raises a larger question about what Hindi war cinema chooses to explore and what it leaves untouched.

The White Lotus goes to French Riviera in Season 4. Meet the ensemble cast The White Lotus 4 confirmed its star-studded cast, including Helena Bonham Carter and Steve Coogan. The show's filming is set to begin in France, marking the series's first season in continental Europe.

Tamil Nadu State Film Awards for 2016-2022 announced: Dhanush, Jai Bhim win big The Tamil Nadu government announced the State Film and Television Awards for 2016 to 2022. The ceremony will take place on February 13 in Chennai.

Border 2 box office Day 7: Sunny Deol film sees slowdown after strong run On its seventh day, Border 2 earned Rs 13.14 crore in India, marking a continued decrease from its strong opening weekend. The war drama, directed by Anurag Singh, stars Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan, Ahan Shetty and Diljit Dosanjh among others.

Arijit Singh didn't quit playback singing, he walked away from a broken system Arijit Singh's decision to step away from playback singing can be looked at as resistance, not retirement. By rejecting a broken, compliance-driven system, the singer seems to have chosen autonomy over industry approval.

Daldal review: Bhumi Pednekar shines in gritty thriller bogged down by repetitionRelease Date:Fri Jan 30, 2026 Bhumi Pedneker's crime-thriller Daldal explores social realities amid an ongoing crime investigation. However, bold themes and strong performances can't fully salvage the series, hampered by redundant flashbacks and clichés. Here's our review.

The Beatles first look: Paul Mescal, Joseph Quinn and cast teased as fab four The Beatles biopic offered a first look as Paul Mescal, Joseph Quinn and others were teased as the Fab Four. The reveal came through postcard visuals ahead of the film's planned 2028 release.

Inside Blake Lively's candid voice message to Justin Baldoni unsealed in court Newly unsealed court documents revealed a candid voice note sent by Blake Lively to Justin Baldoni during the production of It Ends With Us. The message surfaced amid Lively's sexual harassment and retaliation lawsuit, set for trial in May 2026.

You're a real hero: Siddharth Anand to 'delivery boy' mocked by friend in viral post Siddharth Anand won hearts online after he called a delivery boy a "true hero" in response to a viral video mocking the man's job, which was later found to be scripted.

Saina Nehwal on Parineeti Chopra not following her back: Not like we were friends Saina Nehwal has clarified that her association with Parineeti Chopra during the film Saina was purely professional and they never became close friends. Addressing social media chatter, she said follow or unfollow was never a concern as they did not spend time together beyond work.

We all need you back: Gadar director Anil Sharma to Arijit Singh Filmmaker Anil Sharma urged Arijit Singh to reconsider his decision to step away from playback singing, calling him a true genius whose voice the industry still needs.

general news.headline: Maar raha hun, record call: Commando's husband phoned her brother during murderKajal, a Delhi Police SWAT commando, was murdered by her husband Ankur earlier this week, with officials suspecting she was struck with a dumbbell and her family alleging prolonged dowry-related abuse.

Trinamool or BJP: Who would Bengal choose if polls were held today?According to the India Today-CVoter Mood of the Nation survey, the Trinamool Congress's tally is projected to dip slightly, while the BJP is expected to marginally increase its seat share if Lok Sabha elections were held today.

When Ajit Pawar's swap deal helped uncle Sharad remain Defence MinisterIn 1991, when PM PV Narasimha Rao named Sharad Pawar the Defence Minister after Congress's election victory, it was Ajit Pawar, a first-time MP, who gave up his Baramati Lok Sabha seat. The move allowed his uncle to contest from Baramati, enter Parliament and continue in the Union Cabinet. But a swap deal was involved too.

AUS Open Live: Carlos Alcaraz goes 2-0 up against Alexander ZverevAustralian Open Live, Men's Singles semi-final: Carlos Alcaraz has looked dominant thus far, winning the first set 6-4 against Alexander Zverev. The Spaniard is looking to reach his maiden Australian Open final. Later in the day, Novak Djokovic will take on Jannik Sinner.

Cricket nomads: Meet the jersey sellers who travel India match by matchBehind the billion-dollar world of official kits, a nomadic tribe of sellers follows the cricket calendar by rail. Travelling from Bihar, Mumbai and Kolkata to the rest of the country, these daily-wage labourers clothe the masses, navigating thin margins and brand crackdowns to keep the stadium blue.

Ghayab Aya: Mystery behind Virat Kohli's Insta disappearance and reappearanceVirat Kohli's Instagram account mysteriously disappeared overnight on January 30, and what followed next was unmanageable curiosity among fans on social media.

The film's unique silent narrative challenges viewers to reflect on morality amid chaos.

Remembering Sir Mark Tully, Mr BBC!His was the voice of trust and credibility, attributes built over time and years of painstaking travels across the length and breadth of a vast country. He was witness to cataclysmic events over several decades as the BBC's India bureau chief and made brand BBC a household name.

After firing 16,000 employees, Amazon plans to invest in OpenAIAfter laying off 16,000 employees, Amazon is in talks to invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI, showing how aggressively it is betting on artificial intelligence.

Arijit Singh didn't quit playback singing, he walked away from a broken systemArijit Singh's decision to step away from playback singing can be looked at as resistance, not retirement. By rejecting a broken, compliance-driven system, the singer seems to have chosen autonomy over industry approval.

Passionate about modelling, woman dies by suicide after husband calls her monkeyLucknow woman, who was interested in modeling, died by suicide after her husband made fun of her and called her a "monkey." Her body was found hanging in a locked room and taken to Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital, where doctors declared her dead.

Trump threatens 50% tariff, decertification of Canadian jets in trade escalationIn a post on Truth Social, Trump said the move would take effect unless Canada immediately certifies business jets made by US aircraft manufacturer Gulfstream Aerospace. He accused Ottawa of wrongly and illegally refusing certification for several Gulfstream models.

What the EU leaders ate at Rashtrapati Bhavan: A Himalayan MenuPresident Droupadi Murmu hosted a grand dinner for Antonio Costa and Ursula von der Leyen, featuring an exquisite spread of Himalayan delicacies, including yak cheese, mushrooms and millets.

Dhurandhar on OTT: Fans upset as Netflix censors, mutes scenes of Ranveer's filmAfter creating waves globally, Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' is streaming on OTT. However, fans are quite disappointed with Netflix as the platform muted and censored certain scenes of the 'A' rated film.

Hotels in Europe, villas in Dubai: Inside the luxurious empire of Khamenei's sonA year-long Bloomberg investigation revealed that Mojtaba Khamenei, son of Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, is linked through shell companies and associates to a covert, oil-funded global property network spanning London's 'Billionaire's Row,' Europe and the Middle East -- worth over £100 million -- despite US sanctions and public claims of modest living.

Humiliated by Trump, Canada and EU strike back with IndiaAmid Trump's confrontational diplomacy and hostile trade policies, Europe and Canada have pivoted towards India, a more reliable and stable partner, to diversify their exports. Here's a look at how a number of countries are now thumbing their nose at the mercurial Trump.

Watch: E-rickshaw driver clings on to bonnet as car spins him around after crashA speeding jeep collided with an e-rickshaw in Uttar Pradesh, leaving the driver injured and dragged along the bonnet for a short distance, before bystanders intervened.

Centre cracks down on Android scam; blocks fraud app, Telegram channelsThe Centre cracked down on the Wingo Android scam, blocking its Telegram channels and YouTube videos after probes by the Home Ministry found the app was luring users with quick-money promises while secretly misusing their phones and data.

Watch: Air Force choppers battle raging forest fire in Arunachal at 9,500 feetA massive forest fire in Arunachal Pradesh's Lohit Valley prompted a coordinated response from the Indian Air Force, Army, and civil agencies, while a separate blaze in Nagaland's Dzukou Valley led to the evacuation of stranded trekkers. Officials cite difficult terrain, dry conditions, and strong winds as contributing factors.

NCP to propose Sunetra as Maharashtra Deputy CM, may contest Ajit Pawar's seatA leadership tussle has erupted in the NCP after Ajit Pawar's death, with senior leaders rallying around Sunetra Pawar as a potential successor, as per sources.

sports.headline: India legend PT Usha's husband Srinivasan dies at 67 V Srinivasan, husband of IOA President P T Usha, passed away at 67 after collapsing at home. Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his condolences, highlighting the loss to the sporting community.

Quinton de Kock smashes all-time record in strong warning before T20 World Cup Quinton de Kock fired a strong warning before the T20 World Cup after he notched a 43-ball century against West Indies, helping South Africa win by seven wickets in Centurion.

Virat Kohli's Instagram Profile Vanishes Overnight Triggering Panic Among Fans This report focuses on the sudden disappearance of Indian cricket star Virat Kohli's Instagram profile, which has left millions of followers concerned. The news presenter notes that a visit to his page currently displays a 'profile isn't available' message, suggesting the link may be broken or the account removed. The speaker highlights the impact of this event, stating, 'this has cricket fans being left scrambling for answers after Virat Kohli seemingly vanished from Instagram overnight.' As the most followed Indian on the platform, the absence of his profile has triggered intense speculation across social media. The report mentions that Kohli has not yet released a statement on any other platform regarding whether this is a technical glitch or a deliberate move. Fans remain on the edge of their seats, closely monitoring the situation for any official updates or the restoration of the account.

AUS Open Live: Carlos Alcaraz vs Alexander Zverev 2nd set in tie-breaker Australian Open Live, Men's Singles semi-final: Carlos Alcaraz has looked dominant thus far, winning the first set 6-4 against Alexander Zverev. The Spaniard is looking to reach his maiden Australian Open final. Later in the day, Novak Djokovic will take on Jannik Sinner.

Virat Kohli back on Instagram, fans breathe easy and Anushka gets a break India cricketer Virat Kohli's Instagram account became active again after disappearing overnight. Kohli's verified Instagram account, followed by over 270 million users, had suddenly disappeared from the platform on January 30.

After Iceland, Uganda ready to replace Pakistan in T20 World Cup T20 World Cup: After Iceland, Uganda has continued to troll Pakistan on the uncertainty over the latter's spot in the competition. Uganda have said that they are packed and ready in case Pakistan decide to pull out of the tournament.

How India's all-format obsession is quietly undermining its Test future Shubman Gill's chaotic all-format calendar shows how modern scheduling is eroding red-ball skills faster than results can hide them. No wonder India's Test cricket is on the decline.

Djokovic faces Jannik Sinner, a familiar problem in pursuit of 11th title Australian Open 2026 semifinal: Legendary Novak Djokovic last beat Jannik Sinner in 2023. He now faces a familiar foe once again in the semi-final clash of the tournament. Will an ageing Djokovic be able to fight off an athlete in his prime?

Did Virat Kohli deactivate Instagram account? Fans seek clarity from Anushka Sharma Virat Kohli's Instagram account disappeared on Friday, triggering speculation online as fans flooded Anushka Sharma's comment sections seeking clarity on the cricketer's sudden absence from the platform.

Grace Harris' all-round brilliance, Nadine's four-fer propel RCB into final Royal Challengers Bengaluru reached the WPL 2026 final after an eight-wicket victory over UP Warriorz. Grace Harris and Nadine de Klerk's outstanding performances helped RCB storm into their second WPL final.

Don't disturb chetta: Suryakumar Yadav pokes fun at Sanju Samson on Trivandrum return IND vs NZ: Suryakumar Yadav poked fun at Sanju Samson as the Indian team arrived in Thiruvananthapuram ahead of the final game of the T20I series against New Zealand.

T20 World Cup will get the best out of Maxwell: Ricky PontingRicky Ponting believes Glenn Maxwell can rediscover his form at the T20 World Cup 2026.  Maxwell scored just 76 runs from eight innings in the Big Bash League 2025–26.

Captain Siraj claims four as Hyderabad dominate Chhattisgarh in Ranji TrophyMohammed Siraj led from the front as Hyderabad captain with his four-wicket haul leading the way for Chhattisgarh to be bundled out on the opening day's play.

Saim Ayub shines as Pakistan finally beat Australia in a T20I after 2650 daysPakistan vs Australia, 1st T20I: An all-round performance from Saim Ayub helped Pakistan end a 2,650-day wait for a T20I win over Australia, sealing a 22-run victory at Lahore's Gaddafi Stadium.

Michael Nobbs, Australian hockey great and former India coach, dies after illnessFormer Australian hockey player Michael Nobbs, who coached the Indian men's team at the 2012 London Olympics, has died after a prolonged illness.

Track and field stars found guilty of betting on teammates at major tournamentsGerman discus throwers Henrik Janssen and Steven Richter received three-month suspended bans, while French runner Aurore Fleury faces a six-month ban and a 3,000 Euros fine after admitting to betting on athletics events, in violation of World Athletics Integrity Code rules.

19-year-old Indian grandmaster, Divya Deshmukh set to make her debut in Norway ChessIndian Grandmaster Divya Deshmukh will make her maiden appearance at Norway Chess Women, becoming the youngest competitor in the tournament's recent history and joining a field that includes reigning champions and world-class rivals.

Air pollution forces Mumbai players to wear face masks in Ranji clash vs DelhiMumbai's players were forced to wear face masks on Thursday to protect themselves from pollution caused by nearby construction on the opening day of their Ranji Trophy match against Delhi.

T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Wankhede Stadium, MumbaiT20 World Cup 2026 Venue: The Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai is one of the most loved venues in Indian cricket. The Wankhede promises electrifying action every time players take the field. Wankhede can host up to 33,500 people.

T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Arun Jaitley Stadium, DelhiT20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Built in the centre of New Delhi, the Arun Jaitley Stadium has always been a mixed bag in terms of facilities and aesthetics. However, no one can deny that the 55,000-strong crowd has made the games incredibly memorable in recent years.

T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Narendra Modi Stadium, AhmedabadT20 World Cup 2026 Venue: The Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad is the world's largest cricket stadium. With a capacity of over one lakh spectators, it has consistently hosted marquee events in the cricketing world.

T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Eden Gardens, KolkataT20 World Cup 2026 Venue: The iconic Eden Gardens stadium in Kolkata, will host a total of 6 matches in the tournament. The stadium at the moment can host up to 68,000 people, but there are plans to expand its capacity to 1,00,000.

RCB vs UP Warriorz, WPL 2026 Highlights: Mandhana, Harris take RCB into finalsRCB vs UP Warriorz, WPL 2026, Highlights: The Royal Challengers Bengaluru have qualified for the final of the Women's Premier League 2026, following an eight-wicket victory over UP Warriorz. Smriti Mandhana (54*) and Grace Harris (75) led their team's run chase from the front and helped RCB chase down 144 in 13.1 overs.

Rybakina beats Pegula in nervy semi final to set up revenge clash with SabalenkaElena Rybakina advanced to the Australian Open 2026 final after a straight sets win over Jessica Pegula. She now faces world No 1 Aryna Sabalenka, aiming for revenge for her 2023 final defeat.

2036 Olympic bid: Why aquatics, rowing, cycling are key to India's medal plansAs India works behind the scenes on its bid to host the 2036 Olympics, infrastructure is not a major worry, with Ahmedabad appearing largely ready for the challenge. What officials are focusing on instead is a rethink of India's medal strategy, particularly in sports like aquatics and cycling.

EFI sends rape-accused member as coach to Jordan, Sports Ministry issues noticeEFI's decision to appoint rape-accused Tarsem Singh as coach for the upcoming Jordan qualifiers has triggered widespread outrage, further deepening the crisis surrounding the embattled federation. The Sports Ministry has now issued a show-cause notice to the Equestrian Federation of India (EFI).

Pakistan don't have the guts to boycott T20 World Cup 2026: Ajinkya RahaneAjinkya Rahane has made a strong statement on Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2026 boycott theatrics. Despite off-field drama, Pakistan are set to participate with flights already booked to Sri Lanka.

After handshake snub, Sabalenka thumps Svitolina to move into Australian Open finalAustralian Open 2026: Aryna Sabalenka took a crushing straight-set win over Elina Svitloina to secure her fourth consecutive finals appearance at the Australian Open.

Elina Svitolina skips handshake, pre-match photo vs Aryna Sabalenka at Aus Open semisElina Svitolina skipped the handshake and pre-match photo before her Australian Open semi-final against Aryna Sabalenka. The decision followed a familiar pattern shaped by politics, tension and recent history between the two players.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
